Description: Arab heads, one of four studies for Plate 112 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; head and shoulders of a man in profile to left wearing turban and beard, with a study of a mule or donkey above Pen and grey ink and graphite
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by the artist. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum. See also 1836,0109.181.a See also 1836,0109.182 See also 1836,0109.180.b
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
